alert.note: Alert for Adams; Clay; Kearney; Nuckolls; Thayer; Webster (Nebraska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Hastings (North Central Kansas and South Central Nebraska)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued September 17 at 3:36AM CDT by NWS Hastings
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of northern Jewell, northeastern Smith, southwestern Clay, Nuckolls, Franklin, Webster, southern Adams, eastern Kearney and southwestern Thayer Counties through 415 AM CDT... At 336 AM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from near Hildreth to 6 miles south of Inavale to near Lovewell State Park. Movement was north at 25 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph and isolated pockets of penny size hail possible, although any hail in most places will likely be smaller. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Minden, Superior, Red Cloud, Blue Hill, Deshler, Nelson, Hildreth, Campbell, Lawrence, Bladen, Roseland, Guide Rock, Holstein, Burr Oak, Hardy, Upland, Ruskin, Ayr, Formoso and Riverton. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. These storms may intensify, so be certain to monitor local radio stations and available television stations for additional information and possible warnings from the National Weather Service.

area.areaDesc: Adams; Clay; Kearney; Nuckolls; Thayer; Webster
